N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 645-6.15 - Final decision

State Regulations
(a) The
final decision of the commission may include a ruling upon any matter brought
before or decided by the hearing officer, except for those matters for which an
interim appeal is provided under sections
645-6.4
(f) and
645-6.6
(d) of this Subpart. The commission's decision shall be made after the official
closing of the hearing record and shall be mailed to the applicant and the
applicant's attorney of record (if any) by certified mail and to all other
parties by ordinary mail. (b) The
commission's decision shall be made upon consideration of the report and the
complete record, supported by substantial evidence, and shall be in writing
stating the reasons for the action taken. Where applicable, the commission
shall take into account any FEIS prepared for the proposed project, and shall
include a statement of findings pursuant to SEQR. Notes
